title: BBC pins hopes on mystery of Oscar Wilde's disappearing nephew for Podcast success
text:
Arthur Cravan’s disappearance was a tantalising mystery. The nephew of Oscar Wilde, with a taste for elaborate stunts, took his boat out to sea off the coast of Mexico in 1918 and never returned.

Did he capsize and drown? Did he jump overboard? Or did he fake his own death and show up several years later in Paris, as a dealer of fake Wilde manuscripts?

A new 10-part BBC podcast, The Escape Artist, will tell the story of Cravan, an eccentric character who pulled off the unlikely career double of poet and boxer.

Billed as “part drama, part detective story, part documentary”, it will be broadcast on Radio 3 and made available to binge online.

It is one of several podcasts being launched by the...
